content.description: An equation for the line tangent to the graph of the differentiable function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="x equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="y equals, 9 x minus 12" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>9</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following statements must be true?
content.question: <math alttext="f of 0, equals negative 12" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="f of 2, equals 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></math><math alttext="f prime of 2, equals 9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
